values:
It's 1:40 in the morning and my roomate and I are sitting in our room wearing nothing but bathtowels and our underware with the door open....why you may ask? we have just gotten back from partaking in the age-old aggie tradtion of Pond hoppin'!! that is where a group of people run around campus late at night jumping into all the fountains, at least on one side of the tracks. we hit all 5 tonight!! First was Cain which has a huge Styrofoam Eagle on top of it which we skipped/ some guys putted tennis balls to and we played and swam in it.  then we leaped to the MSC where we  stood on the waterfall part.  next we sang songs all the way to H2O where we all got into the top tier and sang Kum-by-ya. then to Rudder where we swing danced (one of the SA's is a HUGE swing-dancer and he threw me in the air for a while, it was AWESOME!!!) then on to the hallowed Fish Pond (where they throw the yell leaders after we win a game) where we were caught by the cops but they let us go if we were gone by the time they got there, luckly our hall is right next to fish pond so we ran in and froze our asses off, but it was totally worth it.  In all an AWESOME evening...I'll take ya'll if you come down here...my roomate and I don't mind visitors in the least...we are gettin' along great!!
    This week my hall has had loads of stuff for us to do...yesterday we went to the Rec where we had open access to everything...i even took a turn off one of the diving platforms. i am definatly going to go to some of the swimming&diving events there.  on wednesday evening we had a pancake pajama party were the SA's made pancakes for all of us and then we had Karaoke (i was in a group that performed a garth brooks song).  last night everyone went to "the hall" (a country western dance hall)  but I coundnt go b/c i'm not 18...1 more week...so i watched the Mask of Zorro upstairs. you could tell we were in the Nerd's dorm b/c we were analyzing all the action parts (like how a bullet can't make someone fall backwards and how we could make a flaming sword) which was hilarious! anyways...I absolutly LOVE this dorm...and the people's in it!!!
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/10834.html

soo...i got back from fish camp ("brainwashing" though not really) last night and moved into my dorm.  I was the only one there, so i watched trouble with angels and unpacked then went to sleep.  i set my alarm for early this morning so my roomate wouldnt walk in and see me asleep, which would have happened because her dad walked in at about 8 and thought i was her (yeah we look alike).  I helped her unpack, and we talked...we get along real well.  her parents left b/c they have to drive back to brownsville today, so we went to mass together and i came here b/c my computer aint in, which is sad...anywhoo that's what's up.
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/10730.html

i'm learning how to use my calculator...its AWESOME i love how it does most everything for me.  i'm here at STEP learning how to survive engineering first year and the first 2 wks or preface of the classes.  the physics prof is cool, math is simple, and engr 111 is evilly scary.  the past 2 days i overslept and skipped class, which is bad...but nothing compared to the drinking going on last wk, they got really pissed, but that's understandable.  1 night we escaped to the abandoned 4th floor because the lower you go the more drinking you get into.  we were up till 4, four of us just talking.  the next night i was up till 4 watching the notebook across the hall.  i'm sick of sandwhiches and fried food, which is all they are serving us.  anyways, class is now dismissed, i'll update more later.

this from mo:

1. Reply with your name and I'll respond with something random about you.
2. I'll tell you what song/movie reminds me of you.
(number three available upon request)
4. I'll say something that only makes sense to you and me.
5. I'll tell you my first/clearest memory of you.
6. I'll tell you what animal you remind me of.
7. I'll ask you something that I've always wondered about you.
8. If I do this for you, you must post this on your journal. You MUST.
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/10480.html

soo...im in this old hotel in the small mountain old west town of Fort Davis, TX.  It is so cool (plus it has wireless internet, which is great.  the atmosphere of the hotel makes me feel like i have stepped into a time machine, the entry way looks like one of those old west hotels.  its a cool place, i want to come back here sometime and stay for longer, seems like a good place to take pictures and write. there is a balcony right outside our room that overlooks the town square and surrounding mountains.  im here to visit my sister who is doing field work about 70 miles from here, but this is one of the closer towns, there are no chains here, the resturant at the hotel was so good, i want another one of their dinner salads, it was awesome! and their pie, french silk, yummy! my brother is saying that i write so improperly, but that's his problemo.  tomorrow we head up to santa fe where i'll be for 2 weeks about, should be fun.
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/10035.html

i got here to alaska, weather's cloudy and cold...we went out on the boat this weekend, very pretty...american/alaskan airlines lost our luggage, so had no clothes except the ones on my back for two days until we went into anchorage for a pair of jeans and a pack of socks and underwear, all the best ever! i heart wal-mart jeans mucho!!they actually fit! anyways...sleepy time even though it looks like its 6 here, but its 11.
anna: e-mail me your e-mail address, i dont have my address book online my address is mariacatanach112@comcast.net
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/9965.html

Sooo...
-Euro final:All nighter doing it, but i got it done at 9:00 (it was due by 9:50 and its a 45 minute drive), got a 88 on it, i think he graded this one harder than last one. after that, leslie, john, one of leslie's friends from jesuit, andrew and i hung around school for a while (leslie and john marked up the junior's cars with 05 with shoe polish, i was lookout) then leslie kidnapped andrew and i, we went on a high speed race all over dallas against john and rodrigo, which was scary, but i lived...we went to walgreens to copy some pictures, and that's it for that...
-senior dinner: HILARIOUS!!!teachers making fools of themselves before we graduate, dancing and singing to old songs dressed up...very good, the senior video was great too (corboy as sister cecilia with a parot on his back)
-graduation junk:lived through it, took forever...played poker after baccalaurte over at bednarz's which was fun, i lost all my money
-a&m:signed up for my classes, don't start until 9 on everyday except friday when i start at 11 and end at 2, on mondays i have a lab from 7:30-9, which sucks, but that's ok...im taking: fundamentals of engineering, honors university (calc based) physics, math 152 (bc topics, i figured it would be better to be bored than suicidal), state and local government, then intro to nuclear engineering, which should be fun...there are 60 incoming freshmen in the department, of that 9 of us are female, which is fine...before the new student conference, i was therese's slave...scraping wallpaper, priming her room, eating what she wanted me to eat...what a blast

that's about it, i leave for alaska for an hour...so that'll be funness.
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/9573.html

not really, i have to do my euro final because i failed the project cause i didnt care any more, but that's ok, just as long as i was exempt from calculus and government, im happy!! I dont think it has hit that i am totally done with high school, but that's ok.  The past two days, the seniors have totally thrown out the rules, i walked around in flip flops yesterday and delivered a note to ms mehen's room on the other side of the school in a rolling chair, which was awesome!! we didnt do a senior prank, our class is not organized enough to pull it off, but that's ok.  i brought in cakes on thursday for calculus and euro classes, shano decorated the one for euro, it was very good, she has so many talents...i wasnt feeling too well yesterday, so i had to cancel dinner with Andrew, which was sad and i felt horrible doing it, but the thought of food made me want to throw up, so we are going to the choir concert tonight, which will be fun.  today its just so hot outside...
Signing uniform shirts was so fun!! mine is almost all full of pictures and notes in all colors thank God for multi-colored sharpies!!
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/9311.html

PROM IS TODAY!!!
i have had my hair and make-up done because i cant do either and its my senior prom.  didnt get a date, but that is totally cool, it means i am not tied down by anything.  yesterday was fun, eddie had to be at school at 7:20, but i didnt have to be there unitl 9:20 because seniors got to skip junior ring ceremony.  i didnt want to stay at school that long, so i left for IHOP when the others started school, planning on doing my chemistry homework.  i got there and saw john and shannon eating, so i joined them...very fun.  we then went to 7-11 and got slurpees.  when i got back to school, there was no parking cause all the junior parents were there, so i had to park far far away and move later.   after school, shopping for prom stuff, which was fun.  then sleep. 
today, getting ready for prom!!

new user pict: the chicken!!!one of my homes next year probably!!!
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/9177.html

TAPPS Trip: left school about 8:30 for Austin, sat next to tina, she did chem i studied bio for the science competition.  we stopped in waco for lunch, taco bell, and then loaded up the bus again.  her mom texted her saying that the pope had died, but then we heard he didn't, so it was confusing.  chris was happy and praying for him to die, which is just horrible.  we played MAO which is an awesome card game if you have never played it.  the only thing you know at the start of it is that it is like uno, other than that, you have to learn the rules as you go and new rules are made up by the winner, for example, when you lay down a nine you have to hit greg.  it is a fun game and you can't talk during it, which was nice because we were sick of pope talk by that time.  Eventually we got down to Austin, where we had to stay at Concordia until 3 when Motel 6 let us check in.  We played MAO somemore and watched some college students play role-playing games where they were fighting with foam swords, it was crazy.  We then went back to the hotel where we just hung out in our room for a while watching TV and talking.  We went to dinner at Applebee's where we got a brownie to play a joke on sister with (we put it in her room and wrote "brownie check" on it...two years ago some kids brought pot brownies on this trip, so she does a brownie check on the bus) it was great.  I had prelimes that night, and it went okay, but i didnt advance which was fine by me, more free time on saturday.  once i got back, we studied science until about 11.  got up the next morning, headed to Concordia to take the science competition, they stuck all of us in one room with 5A, so there were over 30 of us jammed into this tiny classroom.  I sat next to someone who will be in the Nuc department next year with me at A&M, which was cool.  The test wasnt bad, i placed 6th, tina placed 3rd and greg placed 2nd.  Advanced math was next, and it went fine, i didnt place, but i beat greg in score which is good.  the rest of the day was boring because Concordia is a tiny campus with noting around it.  i was in charge of tabulating the scores as they came in to get our place, we were close with Houston Duschene, but we pulled ahead with wins in Block IV, so we are state champs!!! we left late, about 7, it was dark and they didnt turn on the bus lights, so there was nothing to do but talk, sleep, and play on the labtop.  we stopped in waco again for a snack and got home at about 11:30.

Rest of Weekend: sleep

Yesterday: nothing

Today: actually got calc done, made up euro test, math competition after school, talked to inman (who responed to the survey suprisingly)who is taking The Count of Monte Cristo off the sophmore reading list which sucks for them because that was a great book, much better than the movie, the Count is so much more evil and cunning.  He is putting in Sophie's World, which is about philosophy, boring.

Plans: calculus party on friday, gotta learn how to play hold 'em by then for the poker after, shopping on saturday, sleep whenever
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/8860.html

As written by Daniel Salzman): Welcome to the 2005
edition of getting to know your friends. What you are
supposed to do is copy  (not forward) this entire
e-mail and paste it onto a new e-mail that you'll
send. Change all the answers so they apply to you, and
then sen  this to a whole bunch of people including
the person who sent it to you.  The theory is that you
will learn a lot of little things about your friends,
if you did not know them already. 

1. What time did you get up this morning? 10ng time ago (about 5:45 i guess, i can't believe i just used numbers as letters, that's what three or four hours of calc and chem do to you)
 
2. Diamonds or pearls?  is there a neither? ok, pearls i guess cause oysters are cool
 
3. What was the last film you saw ? i just listened to Casablanca while doing homework, its how i get it done, classic

4.  What is your favorite TV show? new: Medical Investigation (ER without the drama and with more science) old: Hogan's Heroes-totally mindless, unrealistic show to get my mind off everything, I got the first season on DVD during Spring Break, Whoop!!!
 
5. What did you have for  breakfast? Half of a papa john's breadstick and part of a piece of cold pizza, healthy i am not
 
6.  What is your middle name?  Alicia

7. What foods do you dislike?  BANANAS, mushrooms, chicken, most poultry

8. What are your favorite Potato chips?  ruffles with French onion dip

9. What is  your favorite CD at the moment? Big&Rich Horse of a Different Color
 
10. What kind of car do your drive? A little Red Truck (Ford Ranger Edge)

11. Favorite sandwich?  not much into sandwiches, but pork roast with lots of lemon pepper

12. What characteristics do you  despise?  One mindedness, inability to talk about anything but one issue, general annoyance, girls who don't think for themselves, all around stupidity

13. Favorite item of clothing? My wizard and dragon pajama pants

14. If you could go anywhere in the world on
vacation, where  would you go?  A journey through Eastern Europe with no itinerary staying in hostels.

15. What color is your bathroom?  white wall paper with pink and green marks on it with sailboats on the edges

16. Favorite brand of clothing? none really, i like t-shirts i get from events, colleges, and people bring me from bars

17.  Where would you retire to? a farm

18. Favorite time of day?  mid morning, im just getting up most of the time and its is bright outside and birds are still chirping

19. Favorite sport to watch? COLLEGE football, the pros suck

20. Person you least expect to send this back to
you? Scott from nuc camp because i havent talked to him in a while and i dont think he checks his e-mail that often

21. Person you expect to send it back first? Anna if she gets it, or Mo after i post this

22. What fabric detergent do you use? I have no idea, i forgot to pick some up the other day
 
23. Coke or Pepsi? neither, they make my teeth feel weird, plus i have enough dental problems because of my love of eating lemons and limes straight like oranges

24. Are you a morning person or night owl?  look at the time and take a wild guess

25. What is your shoe size?  8

26. Do you have pets?  GGK (pipi or gigi) my cat that my sister thinks is the devil because it tried to kill her, Daphainine (Daphane, my sister tried spelling it and that's how it came out- my cocaine ADD dog), 7 Leopard Geckos, 2 snakes (one is a milk snake the other i think is a king snake, but im not sure)

27.What did you want to be when you were little? 
The one i kept coming back to was marine biologist

I've decided to add a few questions...
(as thought up by Shannon...)

28.Why did you decide to fill out this quiz? something to do besides sleep and i would forget to do it later

29.What is your favorite season? Winter, i like snow, but not to much, one of the many reasons im not going to Notre Dame

30.What is your favorite thing about yourself...(come
on, I'm letting you be self-centered for a minute)? my heritage, my hands/nails, my uniqueness/randomness, my energy when i am going completely nuts 

31.How tall are you? 5'1 3/4" (I have the doctor measure me every time i go, a couple of times they said that i shrunk, so i gave the highest reading)

32.What's something about you (a characteristic,
opinion, etc.) that few people know about (hidden,
embarrassing, whatever)? I'm not a conservative as people think, if a person has just met me they would not guess that i am the most normal in my family, and here's for the shocker: i love to dance, ballet calms me (before TAPPS preliminaries, i was in the hall with my shoes off doing ballet positions and jumps, i think they thought i was weird, but oh well)

33.Ah...this one comes in good use...when's you're
birthday? September 1, 1987 

34.What is your biggest pet peeve? people going on and on about one thing example. Chris this entire weekend and week on the pope and how he is glad that he died

35.(ending this on an even number, so to speak) An
African or a European Swallow? European, because it would have a cool accent and know lots of languages.  

My added questions because i dont feel like going to bed yet:
 
36. If you could be any animal what would it be?  A three-toed sloth, naturally get up only one hour a day, once i go to sleep i can never get up, its getting to sleep that's the hard part
 
37. Favorite street on the way to school?  Bethany Road, there is absolutely NOTHING on it, it just curves through a field, you can go as fast as you want on it and no one would care
 
38. Criminal name: "La enchilada sangre"
 
39. Favorite picture book as a kid: Cloudy with a chance of meatballs
 
40: Favorite car game: the element game my brother and i made up where we spell things we see with elements from the periodic table,  CAr WAsH
 
ok, i guess ill go to bed now, wont be asleep for another hour about, get up in two after that. 
 
Margarita Sanchez de la cruz de la muerte la tres
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/8461.html

we won in both academics AND art, so we kicked some butt!! I got 6th in science and did not place in my other two, but oh well, i still am eligible for a ring and letter jacket!! more later because i am really tired after the bus ride and everything.
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/8373.html

I am so glad that i have TAPPS state tomorrow, so im missing a chem test that sister told us about yesterday and a euro test i just didnt want to study for! its greatness.  leave tomorrow at 8 get back saturday at 11pm.  i have prelims in oratory tomorrow at 8pm, so wish me luck!! then i have science and advanced math the next morning.  in between, the fun that comes when you put a bunch of nerds together, should be interesting...
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/8189.html

Spring break summary: sleeping and cleaning...my room is most of the way done. That's about it. Served on Good Friday, we had 10 of us. Served mass yesterday, which was totally awesome, Easter Vigil is the best mass ever, LOTS of fire. We had the big Pascal bonfire thing out front of the church, this year we remembered to bring marshmallows and hot dogs, which we roasted over the fire because it wasn't blessed yet. We made s'mores for people, the first one went to Father Tim, who requested his marshmallow to be golden brown and then we exposed Father Antony to s'mores for the first time (he's our imported priest from India) he first asked us, "will it kill me?" he asked that about five times before he ate it. he like them. We have started a new tradition, i bet that we are the only church to roast marshmallows and hot dogs on the Pascal fire. That's my excitement for Spring break. Two more days until back to school, but only for two days because im going to TAPPS Academic competition down in Austin for Science, Advanced Math, and Original Oratory. That's about all here, very boring week.
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/7741.html

wow, spring break is finally here! whoop for that! except all my friends are in europe, but that's ok, that makes me free to clean my room and possibily move the very old, beat up, but comfortable couch from downstairs to my room, which would be awesome, so friends can stay up there with me.  i may be able to get down to college station, which would be fun and possibily another calculus party, which are always fun, especially when brownies are involved.  that's my plans for the ten days i have off, i may get to my euro timeline, which would be awesome.
musical has been done for almost a week, its kindof sad, the last night was tear-jerking, ms may and ms sawyer talked to us seniors and went around and hugged us and told us thanks for everything.  during the show, my allergies were nuts which sucked, but the night before was a great show with carla and i dancing up there and everything.  cast party was fun, i still cant believe i supplied most of the music: someone wanted disco, and i had bee gees and then i also brought thriller and devil went down to georgia, everyone was dancing, frank and addison did a rendition of the devil went down to georgia, and we even got ms may to dance.  slept over at anna's because i didnt want to drive home late.  after the show on sunday, we had strike, i had to drive trash to the dumster and then i sorted screws and bolts with john, shannon, and kelly.  then we had a small party after and heard jason cavanar sing a song for the seniors, "this is the seniors' last show...anything goes..." it really was very good.  then it was over.
i miss musical, people no longer have to stay during early dismissal or go nuts, though i still see mia during school, its not the same.  oh well.  just about thirty five days left of school i think.  we gave our presentation on wednesday, the first to go, it went well, we showed our pictures with us in jumpsuites and my name: Margarita Sanchez de la cruz de la muerto la tres "la enchilada sangre"- i was in jail because someone called me taco and i got a "little" upset.  Shannon was Jenny Lou McCormick-"the shameful shamrock" and Marie was "Georgia Anne".  Good times. had a calculus party at andrew's on wednesday night, started late and ended about 11:30.  Mrs. Bednarz made brownies for us, which was very nice and she let me keep some of them because she is nice.  that's about all going on here, tomorrow is regional science fair, so i wish thomas good luck with that, he and my parents are working on the board right now, im in charge of the coke dog.  therese should be up here tonight sometime.
i cant believe it, i am actually reading a steinbeck book for fun!! i used to hate his books, but after i read of mice and men again, it was pretty good, so i am now reading Tortilla Flat, which does not seem depressing and sounds like the milagro beanfield war a little.  so far its good, the characters are always getting wine by the gallon for a dollar a piece.
so that's how everything stands, ill probably be updating more because i dont have school this week. so yeah.
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/7472.html

Tech week. it is almost done, very sad.  It has been fun, and i have been doing good with homework, so i can just go home and go to bed.  Last week was the crazy week where i was at school from about 7:30 am to 11:00 pm.  I was worried if we would be ready, but we are doing great.  I got Flydeck with Carla, it was only okay at first, but now we are having fun up there dancing to "Blow Gabriel," the "Heaven Hop" and "Bon Voyage" that is the hazard of musical, you get all the songs and dances into your mind and can't get it out.  my important part is where i raise the blackout curtain during "All through the Night" to reveal Hope and the sailors.  it is exciting.  headsets have gotten more fun, last night we talked about cheesecake on them.  good times.  that is the technical side of things, now the fun parts:

-dinner: has been pretty good, fun eating with all the other peoples.  good food.
-blackfriar traditions: always fun, singing songs from "Once Upon a Mattress" from last year is great.  meeting in the choir room before showtime it is like we are a family, we all sing together and then pray.  Then everyone goes onstage
-Mia and Me being crazy: welcoming the cast to the stage out of the choir room game style (high fives, pep talk) very very fun.  we originally got stares, but now the cast and crew play along and get excited.  we get hugs from people too so we get our traditional three hugs.  Also, we have a theme thing for each hall in the theatre: ballet arms, one that changes every night (beauty queen, flower girl, spy, bowing, Mia stanging straight, me crouching down and going back and forth rotating between the two positions), and random jumping.  Gary the orchastra guy looks at us and says, COD- crew on drugs.  the parents think we are crazy one calls us sisters even though we look absolutly nothing alike.  we talk to the xylophone man about the nodes and antinodes of the xylophone.  during intermission we go out to the atrium and get cookies and food, then talk to the cast about random things, like "The Circle" to scare them.  its fun.  we move el brigo out and other things.  the sophomore crew idiots are still annoying and call us psyco, Sandore says that they are backwards and should not be talking.
-Costume crew: rocks as usual.  Anna, Amanda, Lauren, Debbie, Colette- great group of people.  good sanctuary and i get to put my junk back there.  They even curled my hair today! yay!
-After the show: meeting people, getting flowers from Tina
-IHOP- after show traditional IHOP trip, my last one happened today :(.  i went last week, small group.  today it was a large group and we were all going nuts.  We had to share the room with a different group and i think we scared them by crowding around the window to watch John and Rachel's "light-saber duel" going on in the parking lot and then applauding the winner when Rachel came back in and singing random musical and drinking songs.  good times had by all.  Tomorrow is the cast/crew party at Kelly's house and then strike on Sunday night where we dismantle everything.

School side of my life:
-English: Invisible Man, by Ralph Ellison, is the WORST book ever written.  you know it is bad when out of the entire AP English class not one person actually read the book, it is that bad.  the main character is whiny, there is no flow or structure, Harlem Renaissance just sucks anyway.  We did get to watch "Family Guy" for it in order to see how one culture can want to become another.  I dont know what we are doing now, we are going to do our project tomorrow.
-Government: Still hate it.  Field Trip to the courthouse was cool, saw a murder trial where a father shot and killed his son and we got to see the mother who witnessed the entire thing testify.  It was very interesting.  Amanda, Chris, Brianna, Sean, Catie and i stuck together during the day, we ate at the Corner Bakery downtown because it was quiet and none of the other kids were going there.  We then walked around the West End through the mall and candy stores.  We had to go back to school though eventually.
-Econ: absolutly nothing
-Euro: still fun class, Dr. Morris is a great teacher.  we had a fire drill today and did not want to come inside, but evenatually some of the class gave in to the rules and went back in.  I passed my test with an 84 without studying except in calculus.
-Chem: I got a 94 on my test, missing all 6 points on a relatively easy set of questions on conjugate acids and bases.  Scored well at the National Chemistry Olympiad, tied with Ashton but he got more of the last 10 right, so he got to go.
-Calculus: Finially caught up in that evil crime against humanity.  I was two or three weeks behind in homework.  John, Greg, Andrew and I had a series of calculus parties to get caught up because our half of the room was all very behind.  i had two at my house until about 11:30.  I have actually done my homework for next week, we are finially out of converging and diverging series and on to the fun subject of vectors.
-Office Aide: just running stuff all over the school.  Mrs. Boase is so funny, rushing out to her van at 12:20 to watch her soap opera.  Mrs. Puskarich is the sweetest lady at BL.
-Early Dismissal: thank God i have it. that is all i can say.  i wrote my gov paper during it, and during tech week John and i would get at least some calculus done during it in the library.  one day i challenged someone to a game of chess because he did not believe i knew how to play, he beat me in two minutes the first time, but the second time, i was putting up a fight.  Yesterday, i had to run to Minyards to get food for concessions and then i went to 7-11 for a slurpee.  when i got back, John and Samantha asked me if i wanted to go to the bank with them, and since i had nothing else to do i went.  i survived Sam's driving.  then we went to Casa Linda bakery, good ginger bread men for only a dollar for a good sized cookie.

That is my life right now.  School and Musical, last show is Sunday, then i dont know what i will do with my time.  About 40 days till graduation and a week until spring break! yeah! Now that i know i am going to A&M and will be in Lechner, if i got my thing in quick enough, i am ready to go!
http://the-velvetskirt.livejournal.com/7401.html

My parents found out where im going to college, so i am free to post it here for the world to see, so here it goes:

i have decided, but to find out, you have to im me because mis padres dont know and i want to keep it that way. in the mean time, heres this, i identify with it more than the one from texas. i found it amusing:
You Know You're From New Mexico When...
You buy salsa by the gallon. You are still using the paper license tag that came with your car five years ago. Your favorite restaurant has a chile list instead of a wine list. You do all your shopping and banking at a drive-up window. Your Christmas decorations include "a yard of sand and 200 paper bags". You have license plates on your walls, but not on your car. Most restaurants you go to begin with "El" or "Los". You remember when Santa Fe was not like San Francisco. You hated Texans until the Californians moved in. The tires on your roof have more tread than the ones on your car. You price-shop for tortillas. You have an extra freezer just for green chile. You think a red light is merely a suggestion. You believe that using a turn signal is a sign of weakness. You don't make eye contact with other drivers because you can't tell how well armed they are just by looking. You think six tons of crushed rock makes a beautiful front lawn. You have to sign a waiver to buy hot coffee at a drive-up window. You ran for state legislature so you can speed legally. You pass on the right because that's the fast-lane. You have read a book while driving from Albuquerque to Las Vegas. You know they don't skate at the Ice House and the Newsstand doesn't sell newspapers. You think Sadies was better when it was in the bowling alley. You have used aluminum foil and duct tape to repair your air conditioner. You can't control your car on wet pavement. There is a piece of a UFO displayed in your home. You know that The Jesus Tortilla is not a band. You wish you had invested in the orange barrel business. You just got your fifth DWI and got elected to the state legislature in the same week. Your swamp cooler got knocked off your roof by a dust devil. You have been on TV more than three times telling about how your neighbor was shot or about your alien abduction. You can actually hear the Taos hum. All your out-of-state friends and relatives visit in October. You know Vegas is a town in the northeastern part of the state. You are afraid to drive through Mora and Espanola. You iron your jeans to "dress up". You don't see anything wrong with drive-up window liquor sales. Your other vehicle is also a pick-up truck. Two of your cousins are in Santa Fe, one in the legislature and the other in the state pen. You know the punch line to at least one Espanola joke. Your car is missing a fender or bumper. You have driven to an Indian Casino at 3am because you were hungry. You think the Lobos fight song is "Louie, Louie" You know whether you want "red or green." You're relieved when the pavement ends because the dirt road has fewer pot-holes. You can correctly pronounce Tesuque, Cerrillos, and Pojoaque. You have been told by at least one out-of-state vendor that they are going to charge you extra for "international" shipping. You expect to pay more if your house is made of mud. You can order your Big Mac with green chile. You see nothing odd when, in the conversations of the people in line around you at the grocery store, every other word of each sentence alternates between Spanish and English. You associate bridges with mud, not water. You know you will run into at least 3 cousins whenever you shop at Wal-Mart, Sam's or Home Depot. Tumbleweeds and various cacti in your yard are not weeds. They are your lawn. If you travel anywhere, no matter if just to run to the gas station, you must bring along a bottle of water and some moisturizer. Trailers are not referred to as trailers. They are houses. Double-wide trailers are "real" houses. A package of white flour tortillas is the exact same thing as a loaf of bread. You don't need to write it on your shopping list; it's a given. At any gathering, regardless of size, green chile stew, tortillas, and huge mounds of shredded cheese are mandatory. Prosperity can be readily determined by the number of horses you own. A tarantula on your porch is ordinary. A scorpion in your tub is ordinary. A poisonous centipede on your ceiling? Ordinary. A black widow crawling across your bed is terribly, terribly common. A rattlesnake is an occasional hiking hazard. No need to freak out. You actually get these jokes and pass them on to other friends from New Mexico.


Get Your Own "You Know You're From" Meme Here

More cool things for your blog at Blogthings

from thrusday...plus a rant on college and future stuff:

i felt too sick with cold/allergies/cough/sore throat/headache/sleepiness to judge st. thomas's science fair, even though i really needed those points after failing the last chem test :( but hopefully ill do well at tapps state so sister will be really happy and give me lots of extra credit.  but i really needed to sleep, which is what i did that night.  yesterday, i slept somemore, did some homework, then headed off to amanda's suprise birthday party.  that was an experience.  i was actually the first one there for once, went into the place which is a lot like hooters, i walk in by myself, the only female there not wearing spandex shorts and low-cut shirt and under 21, among many forty-something ex-biker people so i called anna and fleed back to my truck to wait for her.  no one was answering their phones, so we waited in her car for a while once she go there.  cecilia and her boyfriend showed up and went inside to be scared just as i was and so the four of us walked over to razoo's for some nice cajun cooking.  we were waiting there when amanda and her boyfriend walk in and we kind-of suprise them in a weird way.  anna called amanda's dad and found out that the party was actually supposed to be tonight, but oh well.  it was a good thing and made amanda happy, so that's good.  anna and i talked most the time by ourselves 'cause the couples were all over eachother, which was weird.  so we talked about how she is gonna profess her love for someone with the "fire of 10000 suns" over a video to ask him to prom and how i would say yes to nearly anyone who would ask me.  any way, the six of us shared one sundae and then anna and i went to the mall because all the couples wanted to be alone, so we drove over to valley view (i survived anna on the road once again!!) and walked around a little tried on some dresses and then went and got a shake and i went home and went to bed because musical was at 8 this morning.

at musical i drove to home depot with sandore to get wood, not so bad, and then to the carpet place.  i worked with mia most of the time, we talked a lot about er of course and other stuff like that.  helped build the handrails and *hopefully* ill be assigned to the flydeck tomorrow. i really want flydeck again.  the set is just about done, we'll finish tomorrow.  tech week is next week!!! i am so freaked! last year it was crazy (I GOT A 50! YEAH, WHOOP! hey anna, that's your 50!, later i got a 20 so it evened out!)  but still very fun cause we're all crazy.  hopefully this year baseball won't flood the gym by hitting a sprinkler and cause the firealarm and fire doors to go off in the rain again like last year, horrible freaking out cause everyone was in costume.  good times, good times.

when i got home, i found out that thomas and i may be by ourselves for a few days, which is not bad at all until i found out that it was at the beginning of tech week when i wont be home until after 11 every night, so there are still issues to work out.  My mom has to go out to california for a funeral and my dad has to go there for meetings.  it'll work itself out hopefully.  i need to get homework done sometime for next week.  i think ill be at the library most of this week getting calculus done and doing my euro project and trying to get some of the reading done in advanced so i wont have to do that next week, just take the quiz with the notes i take this week.  anyway, college.

Here is where i stand on college:
im in at UMR, but i wont go there
im in at A&M, but waiting on scholarships from the office of scholarships and honor's college stuff
still waiting on Notre Dame until March/April
i dont know where ill go, A&M has a good nuc department where i can do policy work through the Bush school of government right there on campus.  i like the atmosphere and the people there.  Therese is there for better or for worse.  i know of two people going there, Greg and Alicia.  Alicia will probably live in Lechner, where i hope to be, which could be good, and i may have engineering classes with Greg which would be interesting to say the least, and Patrick may go there too which would be weird because if the three of us go there we would have had the same math/science curriculum and teachers for eight consecutive years because we were all at st. mark's and bishop lynch's honors classes.  The thing is, most of the people there are from texas, and i want to expand my view of the nation as a whole, i want to be able to visit people from New England, the Northwest, Florida, Mississippi, Arizona, all over, not just Texas, which is what Notre Dame can offer me, in addition to a family dorm environment, which i love and would provide me with life long really close friends, and many community service opportunities and also theology as a class, which i liked having in high school as a place to debate morality and most anything.  it is really pretty and definatly not texas.  i like having a lake on campus and having a small seminar style class freshman year for the core curriculum.  i would probably major in geological studies so i could do hazard risk assessment and mitigation or i am kind of thinking of maybe going into education, but most likely not.  

being a teacher is a way to leave a definate direct impact on people, one of the ten things i want to do before i die.  i think of how my teachers have affected me and inspired me to think outside the classroom and how learning is not a chore.  i think of how i can go in to inman's room and just talk to him about whatever we're doing in english in kantor's class or how therese is an anti-social hermit with her birdies.  how he would lend me money if i ever needed it, like when i had absolutly no money or gas to get home, but i had already gotten some off amanda earlier.  i think of how sister cecilia would stay until after 6:00 working on physics problems with me the night before a test or that time we watched jeopardy in her classroom, of course she got all the answers right being she is a freaking genius!! why she is teaching high schoolers i do not know, but i am glad she is, i mean, she has a docterate, studied at harvard, knows 5 languages, including cherokee, and is a nun, which is kindof odd.  we can ask her anything and she would know somehting about it ranging from russian literature to subatomic theory to where st catherine's heart is (she told us that her body part's were split up across italy once).  i think about storey's class where we would eat everyday and have a huck-finn southern party or a joy-luck club party.  same thing in kantor's class where we watched "Young Frankenstein" because he wanted to and where he has his medieval weapons in the closet and stocks at the front of the class or freaking out because someone put a cross on his board (he's jewish) and then talking about his "jewish gang" in garland where they all where "yamahawks" as he calls them and speak yiddish.  because most of my really good teachers have been english teachers, i feel like that would be a fun and influential occupation, except for one key challenge: i dont know grammer.  anyway, ill just go into nuclear policy and get to inspect places and recieve nice bribes from people.  maybe eventually after i retire or whatever ill become a pernament substitute and get to teach many different classes without having to grade anything.  that could be fun.

okay, so there goes my very long rant on last night, musical, college, and teachers.  more will probably follow at some other time on one or more of these topics.

that's about it that i can think of.  im sick of school and glad that i have an early dismissal now.

yesterday eddie and i went out to breakfast at mimi's (i had promised him we would breakfast last sunday).  that was good.  then i went down to dallas to pick up anna to go downtown.  road the dart there, got off at mockingbird station to get me a pass (i forgot), ran into my 5th grade teacher on break from the conference my mom and all my teachers were at, so we found that all them carry blue bags so we kept an eye out for our teachers.  after we got my pass, some freak about my age came up to me and said he wanted my number so he could get to know me better, i said no, he asked if it was because he was black, i said no, i live far away (i should have pretended that i was taken, but i wasnt thinking) so anna and i ran off after that and prayed for the train to come quick.  we road downtown, saw some more blue bags, we were stopped at one of the stations and we saw sister! we ran off the train to go talk to her.  i had to direct her to the hotel.  anna and i went to eat at the pizza place near the station, then went to the west end.  that wasnt too exiciting, we got back on to the dart and up to mockingbird again, went shopping there for a little while, got back on the dart and saw blue bags from Prince of Peace, they were boring and i wanted to find mrs. good, who teaches there, so we went into the next car, but she wasn't there, BUT i saw the evil, vile, mean, Ms. Harris from pre-cal last year.  anna and i decided to go around to the front of the car to see if she noticed us.  we talked to someone from St. Rita, and i saw Ms. Harris talking to Ms. Shivers and pointing at us, so i had anna say hi, she was nice to anna, but not to me of course.  we told her what we had done, and then we had to get off because it was our stop.   we went to valley view mall, just tried on some prom dresses when i already got mine over the summer for cheap.  i found one that actually fits me, normally i have to have it shortened.  this dress is supposed to be mid shin, but on me, its floor length.  eventually found my way home and took thomas (eddie) to corner bakery for dinner and then to barnes&noble.  i read/looked at texas 24/7, saw the marathon motel, in therese's home (very small town).  then it was infiltrated by crazy teenagers who cant drive, so once the mall closes, they go to starbucks in barnes & noble.  very annoying little children, especially the ones from st. marks.  barnes and noble is for reading, not for annoying people and running around.  we left, came home, and played on the computer.
today i had musical practice this morning. left at 7:30, got there at 8, i love weekends.  worked on getting stuff out of storage, then i helped costumes hem some pants.  that was fun.  went to taco bell for lunch and then went back to school for an ap english study session, but only 5 showed up, so we called it off and went home.  now homework time.

i had a nhs meeting, and an animal rescue meeting, plus i had to be there at 7:30 because ed had a student council meeting, i may run for council, because of open spots and ill be there anyway cause of eddie, but im not sure yet.  i had three new classes on wednesday: government, econ, and tech theater.  government was weird, three of the four biggest liberals of the class are in there, plus the teacher is liberal, so the class will be very slanted.  econ, i couldnt tell it was an ap class because i saw some people in there that defiantly should not have been there, i had to as kasey to make sure i was in the right class.  i didnt get most of what they were saying, but it'll get easier i hope.  in english we were given pictures and had to name the person, give them an occupation, hometown, likes/dislikes, dreams, etc.  after we had done all that and made fun of the people, we asked kantor where he got them and he said, "i went on google and typed in obituaries", so that made us all feel bad.  i looked my dude up and i actually got the first name right, it was weird.  in tech theater, we just took a tour of the theater, which was nice, it was great being able to go back up on my flydeck again.  not much happened on thursday or friday, stayed home friday because i have felt sick all week, have gotten no sleep, and still had loads of homework to do (a two page paper on "what is heaven like?" and a bunch of questions from one of Rousseau's essays, which im not even sure Rousseau understood what he was writing, plus a scale drawing of my room) so i just had a very tiring week, and it all caught up on me.  Today (actually yesterday) i cleaned. yeah. and then we went to half-priced books for about an hour.  i started "The Lovely Bones" at about 10 and finished it about twenty minutes ago.  the first part was really sad, i could not stop crying through it, but then it got sad, and then at towards the end it was just plain weird.  Now i better be off to bed because i have to go to church at 8 in the morning.

My mom and i went out for nail polish after because i got sick of the bright pink i put on while i was in the bathroom afraid to come out a few days ago because that was the only color there and i had nothing else to do while my brother and sister were outside with a banana and they had allready stuffed a gross one up my shirt (i am terrified of bananas). just got back from taking my hopefully last ever high school final.  still in my wonderful uniform, b/c im too lazy to change into normal people clothes.  spent last night making tortillas, over  40 of them, and oatmeal/oatmeal chocolate chip cookies.  i even made some of them into mathematical symbols for my brother such as a pi, a e, a integral, and therese made an infinity.  good times.  took them, minus the math ones to my english class and they ate them up for the most part, i only took a couple of each home.  the final wasnt bad, one section was titled, "how did i lose animation?" or something like that asking how each frankenstein character died.  funness.  got the final done within a half hour, so i just drew and Marie joined me in drawing and soon all of us "4 weirdos by the tv" were drawing on the paper and kantor saw it and said we could put it on the wall. so we were very excited about being immortalized in Kantor's room.  we leave tomorrow for new mexico.  Gave out my gifts today to peoples and got a purse from marie and a bracelet and necklace from tina to add to my candles from bertie, candy from kelly and amanda in addition to a necklace from amanda.  gotta go to school tomorrow to turn in one last app to A&M and to give anna and amanda their presents.  now i get to clean. yeah.

went to the Dallas Museum of Art yesterday with my brother and sister, my brother wanted extra credit for a class he has a 105 in, makes no sense, so he had to see an exhibit on Emperor Quianlong or something like that, so he and therese went there while i went through the rest of the museum.  It was nice.  i loved the contemporary art section with the weird coal dust on a canvas thing and the one canvas with many random drawings.  i also liked the big guy made out of styrofoam and the little figure looking up at it.  good times. i saw lots from the french revolution which is what we were doing in euro, so that was cool.  They had a big area with elements of design, beds, tables, toast rack, silver serving things.  it reminded me of the book, "From the Mixed up Files of Ms. Basil E. Frankwiler" where two kids live in the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York and sleep in the fancy exhibit beds and bathe in the fountain.  its a fun book.  we road the DART down there so i wouldnt have to park downtown, so that was fun.  today i just went to church and went christmas shopping for friends.  now im going to go bake some cookies and make some tortillas.  hopefully i dont burn the house down.  only have english final left, but that shouldnt be too bad, its scantron and only on frankenstein and whose afraid of virginia woolfe.  easy, but messed up books, especially the virginia woolfe one.

just had a all nighter righting 5 papers for history.  i dont feel like going to bed, but atleast i dont have any finals to take tomorrow!! cause i got AP Chem and AP Calc over today-killer day. Chem was not bad at all, but Calc just wore me out because of anxieity after and then i had to take my Chem test on top of it! not cool.  Spent the afternoon, night, and early morning writing history papers.  Im basically done with school unitl january cause my AP english final is a blowoff.  In english on wednesday we watched Office Space and ate brownies, quite enjoyable.  Got my chair done for my sculpture final, wrapping it in yarn was a chore.  the older perfect one, therese, is home, so that's good, i guess.  I cant wait to be on the road to New Mexico and California for christmas.  Its so relaxing just to sleep and then hang out with family and eat good posole and fudge.  Im scared that eddie (thomas) will not turn in my history final for me, so i wrote him about 20 notes and placed them all around the house, going down the stairs, on his uniform, on the sinks, doors, etc.  it was fun and if he forgets it, im gonna cover everything close to him (yes his pocket protector too) in yellow smiley face stickers, and then stand over him one night in my thriller dead hooker costume with full makeup, so he better not forget. just have to wait and see

been a couple of crazy days, but hey finals are approaching.  The drive to school on thursday was more exciting than usual because of a fight going on in the far left lane on Garland Road and Northwest Highway.  There were three guys attacking another guy in a SBC truck.  The guy in the truck was hitting them with the seatbelt and pummeling them with his fists as well.  This went on for a couple of minutes until one of the three guys pulled the other two away.  Their faces were all bloody.  It was weird.  Eddie and I both thought it would be a waste to call the police because the fight would probably end by the time they got there, so we didnt call them, but we saw a police car pass in the other lane.  Crazy, but that's the Dallas Police Department.
     That was the excitement on thursday, i finally finished my teapot, just had to do my Noguchi lamp this weekend and tomorrow ill put the paper on it.  I need to finish wrapping my chair in yarn for my final project due wednesday.  Finished my "sketchbook"-i also did collages, scratchings, and watercolor in it.  OH YEAH! CONGRATULATIONS TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE BISHOP LYNCH CLASS OF 2008: MR.THOMAS A. CATANACH!!!  He beat a football player, so the nerds have conqured the school! WHOOP! Im so proud of you my little (big) Vulcan brother!  Peace and tranquility in landrew (bows head). That was announced on Friday, but i was outside doing my theology work, so i did not hear it immediately.  I wrote my entire theology paper during third period on Friday and it was remotely good.  I did not make it to the dance recital Friday night because i had to do homework and bond with my brother and sister over pizza and pomegranate juice.  I went to the choir concert last night and they kick butt!  They certainly deserve to go to rome.  Amanda did an awesome job on her solo and the Percy the Puny Pointsetta song was very entertaining.  I had to sit on the floor next to bertie, but it's a choir concert so that did not really matter, except for the harmony piece in which we both laughed at anna.That's about it.  Gotta go to bed so i dont fall asleep in sister's class, never a good thing, she may decide to wake me up with hydrochloric or something like that.

calculus homework sucks major.  doing it for over 4 hours sucks even more.  ill finish it tomorrow morning during class.  that's the way to go.  we finished "who's afraid of virginia woolf" today in english and are now watching the movie, very fun.  Almost done with my teapot, the never ending sculpture, just need to glaze inside and finish the top.  chem we talked about physics and how the poor juniors have such innocent young minds.  Xzavier (the kindergartner i tutor for service three times a week) finally remembered the letter l in the alphabet, which was very very good.  i now have to tutor the new kid, Jason in alphabet too.  niceness.  my sister came home late last night to study for her finals here.  she brought her bird, Kosmos, up and flew her today and she landed her first kill, a rat.  I think that in chem we should have a pancake breakfast to study the viscous properties of syrup. that would make everyone in that class very happy and joyful.  i brought my moldy pair of school shoes home today (there were patches of gray fuzz growing on them b/c i had to walk a cripple kid out to the flooded parking lot in the pouring rain during office aide a couple of weeks ago), so my locker and heritage hall no longer pose a major health concern.  Always good to know.
